Package io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.span

Interface MsdxSpan

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
MsdxJavaSpan, MsdxJavaSpan.Keyed, MsdxJavaSpan.Persistent
public interface MsdxSpan
extends java.io.Serializable
A Span is an abstraction representing the data streams which connect the MOSDEX object model with the solver specific modeling objects. A Span is intended to work as a distributed, parallel pipeline that does not realize its content except at its origin and destination. A Span transforms the data that passes through it according to an Operator. Operators are the means by which a solver Modeling Factory specifies the transformations necessary to create and use the solver-specific API in MOSDEX. The sequence of Spans that transforms MOSDEX data into solver-specific modeling objects is called a bridge.

The MOSDEX Span interface is implemented with two concrete classes, based on Java streams or on Apache Spark distributed data sets. The interface specifies the key operations on Spans, which are a subset of the operations available for Spark distributed datasets and Java streams.

The fundamental component of the Span interface is the Container class. A Container holds heterogeneous data together with their class identities, which constitutes the Container's schema. All Containers in a Span must have the same schema.

The classes implementing MsdxSpan do not have public constructors. Instead, each has a companion, static member class implementing the MsdxSpan.Factory interface. The create methods of this companion class provide for construction of Span objects from various input data structures.

Author:
Dr. Jeremy A. Bloom (jeremyblmca@gmail.com) Â©2019 Jeremy A. Bloom

  • Method Details

    • persist

      MsdxSpan persist()
      Saves a Span for reuse by converting this Span to a persistent Span. If this Span is already persistent, copies it to a new instance. A persistent Span realizes its data in memory.
      Returns:
      a persistent Span

    • isPersistent

      boolean isPersistent()
      Returns:
      true if this Span is persistent, false otherwise

    • key

      MsdxSpan key​(java.lang.String keyFieldName)
      Saves a Span for reuse by converting this Span to a keyed Span. If this Span is already keyed, copies it to a new instance.
      Parameters:
      keyFieldName -
      Returns:
      a keyed Span

    • isKeyed

      boolean isKeyed()
      Returns:
      true if this Span is keyed, false otherwise

    • apply

      java.util.stream.Stream<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> apply()
      Returns the items in the Span as a stream of Records. This method is overridden in a persistent Span and a keyed Span. Use of the apply method enables using the inherited transformation methods of this class on either a Record stream or a persistent or keyed Span.

      Note: the inherited methods return a Record stream, so you can perform a series of transformations on the stream without realizing it as a collection. You may need to persist the transformed stream again if you want to reuse it.

    • getAsCollection

      java.util.Collection<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> getAsCollection()
      Returns:
      the Record stream as an unmodifiable view of the collection.
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this instance is not persistent or is not a Java Span

    • getAsMap

      java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,​MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> getAsMap()
      Returns:
      the Record stream as an unmodifiable view of the keyed map.
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this instance is not keyed or is not a Java Span

      java.lang.String getKeyFieldName()

      the name of the key field in the records of this Span, if any, or returns an empty string

    • count

      long count()
      Returns:
      the number of Records in the Span; note, counting is a terminal operation which exhausts the stream, unless there is a collection or map underlying the Span.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns:
      false of there are records in the Span, true if none
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if a stream underlies the Span.

    • getSchema

      MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> getSchema()
      Returns:
      the Schema of the Records in this Span; note, all Records reference the same Schema Container object.

      MsdxSpan select​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> fieldNames)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a new Span with the selected fields

    • leftJoin

      MsdxSpan leftJoin​(MsdxSpan other, java.lang.String keyFieldName, OperatorWithTwoArguments joiner)
      Joins two Spans by combining their Records with a common key, using a left outer join. The result has one Record for each key in this Span. Where there is no matching key in the other Span, the Record fields from the other Span is treated as null.

      Creates new Span with component Containers of the following form:
      [key field value, value1,..., valueM] merge [other key field value, valueM+1,..., valueN] ->
      [key field value, value1,..., valueM, valueM+1,..., valueN]
      and creates a merged schema of the form:
      [key field name and type, field1,..., fieldM] merge [other key field name and type, fieldM+1,..., fieldN] ->
      [key field name and type, field1,..., fieldM, fieldM+1,..., fieldN]
      where all of the Records point to the same Schema.

      The key field names do not have to match between the two Records as long as they have compatible types. The joiner looks at the key fields in the Records of both Spans, and, if the their values match, the two Records are joined. For example, suppose this Span has a Schema
      {rowId: key columnId2: String, term: Expression},
      and the second has Schema {key columnId: String, variable: SolverVariable}.
      If the value in columnId2 matches the value in columnId, the two Records are joined, and the result has Schema
      {rowId: key columnId2: String, term: Expression, variable: SolverVariable}.
      However, by default, it is assumed that the other Record has the same key field name as this one. If the two Spans have different key field names, the result has the key field name of this Span.

      When there is no matching key in the other argument, the joiner maps the missing components to some appropriate, context-specific default values (often null).

      Parameters:
      other - Span to be joined; if other is keyed, it need not have the same key field name as the given key field name, provided that the data in the key fields of the two Spans can be matched. If the other Span is not keyed, a key Span will be constructed from it using the given key field name.
      keyFieldName - in this Span used to match the other Span
      joiner - combines and possibly transforms the two records from the input Spans and provides default values when there in no matching key
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key field is missing either Span or if the types of the key field do not match
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both Spans have fields with the same name but their contents do not match in any pair of records with the same key

    • outerJoin

      MsdxSpan outerJoin​(MsdxSpan other, java.lang.String keyFieldName, OperatorWithTwoArguments joiner)
      Joins two Spans by combining the records with a common key, using a full outer join. The result has one record for each key in both Spans. Where there is no matching key between the two Spans, the joiner maps the components of the missing record to default values.

      Creates new Span with component Containers of the following form:
      [key field value, value1,..., valueM] merge [other key field value, valueM+1,..., valueN] ->
      [key field value, value1,..., valueM, valueM+1,..., valueN]
      and creates a merged schema of the form:
      [key field name and type, field1,..., fieldM] merge [other key field name and type, fieldM+1,..., fieldN] ->
      [key field name and type, field1,..., fieldM, fieldM+1,..., fieldN]
      where all of the Records point to the same Schema.

      The key field names do not have to match between the two Records as long as they have compatible types. The joiner looks at the key fields in the Records of both Spans, and, if the their values match, the two Records are joined. For example, suppose this Span has a Schema
      {rowId: key columnId2: String, term: Expression},
      and the second has Schema {key columnId: String, variable: SolverVariable}.
      If the value in columnId2 matches the value in columnId, the two Records are joined, and the result has Schema
      {rowId: key columnId2: String, term: Expression, variable: SolverVariable}.
      However, by default, it is assumed that the other Record has the same key field name as this one. If the two Spans have different key field names, the result has the key field name of this Span.

      When there is no matching key between the two Spans, the joiner maps the missing components to some appropriate, context-specific default values.

      Parameters:
      other - Span to be joined; if other is keyed, it need not have the same key field name as the given key field name, provided that the data in the key fields of the two Spans can be matched. If the other Span is not keyed, a key Span will be constructed from it using the given key field name.
      keyFieldName - in this Span used to match the other Span
      joiner - combines and possibly transforms the two records from the input Spans and provides default values when there in no matching key
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key field is missing either Span or if the types of the key field do not match.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both Spans have fields with the same name but their contents do not match in any pair of records with the same key.

    • innerJoin

      MsdxSpan innerJoin​(MsdxSpan other, java.lang.String keyFieldName, OperatorWithTwoArguments joiner)
      Joins two Spans by combining the records with a common key, using an inner join. The result has one record for each key in both Spans. Where there is no matching key between the two Spans, the joiner skips that key.

      Creates new Span with component Containers of the following form:
      [key field value, value1,..., valueM] merge [other key field value, valueM+1,..., valueN] ->
      [key field value, value1,..., valueM, valueM+1,..., valueN]
      and creates a merged schema of the form:
      [key field name and type, field1,..., fieldM] merge [other key field name and type, fieldM+1,..., fieldN] ->
      [key field name and type, field1,..., fieldM, fieldM+1,..., fieldN]
      where all of the Records point to the same Schema.

      The key field names do not have to match between the two Records as long as they have compatible types. The joiner looks at the key fields in the Records of both Spans, and, if the their values match, the two Records are joined. For example, suppose this Span has a Schema
      {rowId: key columnId2: String, term: Expression},
      and the second has Schema {key columnId: String, variable: SolverVariable}.
      If the value in columnId2 matches the value in columnId, the two Records are joined, and the result has Schema
      {rowId: key columnId2: String, term: Expression, variable: SolverVariable}.
      However, by default, it is assumed that the other Record has the same key field name as this one. If the two Spans have different key field names, the result has the key field name of this Span.

      The joiner filters any records that do not have a common key value between the two Spans.

      Parameters:
      other - Span to be joined; if other is keyed, it need not have the same key field name as the given key field name, provided that the data in the key fields of the two Spans can be matched. If the other Span is not keyed, a key Span will be constructed from it using the given key field name.
      keyFieldName - in this Span used to match the other Span
      joiner - combines and possibly transforms the two records from the input Spans
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key field is missing either Span or if the types of the key field do not match.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both Spans have fields with the same name but their contents do not match in any pair of records with the same key.

    • merge

      static OperatorWithTwoArguments merge()
      Defines a default joiner for two Spans with the following characteristics: the result schema is the merger of the two input schemas with a single key field inherited from the left Span. the Result record when the keys match is the merger of the two input records. when the right Span has no key match in the left, the default result inherits all the items of the left record and all items corresponding the right fields are set to null.

      Usage:
      MsdxSpan terms= parameters.join(allVariables, "Column", merge());

      Returns:
      an operator that merges the Records of two Spans

    • reduceByKey

      MsdxSpan reduceByKey​(java.lang.String keyFieldName, OperatorWithTwoArguments accumulator)
      For each value of the key field, this method returns a Span that accumulates the elements (i.e. Records) in the other Span corresponding to that key to produce a single result element for that key.

      The accumulator operator defines the fields to be accumulated and how the accumulation is computed (typically, the accumulation is a "sum" of terms, where the sum operation is specific to the solver). The type of the value field in the input Records (in this Span) must match the type of the accumulation field in the result Records, and thus, the accumulator function should verify that condition

      Parameters:
      keyFieldName - defines the field in the input elements to be grouped for accumulation
      accumulator - defines the fields or fields to be accumulated and how the accumulation is computed
      Returns:
      a new Span in which the Records result from applying the accumulator to each group of input Records according to the key field value

    • union

      MsdxSpan union​(MsdxSpan other)
      Creates a new Span that contains all of the Records in this Span and the other Span. Both Spans must have the same Schema, unless one of them is empty, in which case the union inherits the non-empty schema. (Thus, a sequence of unions can be initialized with an empty Span. If this schema is persistent or keyed, so is the union.)
      Parameters:
      other - Span
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Schemas are both non-empty and are not equal

    • show

      default void show​(java.lang.String name, MsdxOutputDestination dst, java.lang.Long limit)
      Writes a Span as a JSON Object. Generally conforms to MOSDEX conventions. Primarily used for displaying the contents of the Span. Note: the various write operations are adapted from the corresponding operations in MsdxObject.Factory.
      Parameters:
      name - used in the display
      dst - destination
      limit - maximum number of records written (null for no limit)

    • show

      default void show​(java.lang.String name, MsdxOutputDestination dst)
      Writes a Span as a JSON Object. Generally conforms to MOSDEX conventions. Primarily used for displaying the contents of the Span. Note: the various write operations are adapted from the corresponding operations in MsdxObject.Factory.
      Parameters:
      name - used in the display
      dst - destination
